website_summaries.verdict: Considering its low price, the build quality is pretty impressive, matching OEM standards.
pros: Includes everything you’ll need for replacing the filter, which isn’t always the case at this price point
Included gaskets consist of high quality materials that prevent leaks
Fits a variety of vehicle models
cons: Installation can be tricky, as you must clean the old sealant first

customer_reviews.title: Preposterous back flushing the filter.. it needs to ...
customer_reviews.text: Preposterous back flushing the filter.. it needs to be replaced.. was black as night when I changed it. So I bought this filter and gasket and replaced fluid with AMSOIL. The rubber gasket was suspect but torqued down in star pattern to 8.5 FTLB its holding for now.
customer_reviews.author: WallStreetsInsane

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2009 hyundai elantra touring
customer_reviews.text: Shame on Hyundai for not promoting filter change. Lots of crud in existing (original after 100k) filter, so i'm hoping this may slow tranny wear. I used rubber gasket included with filter, will update if gasket doesn't hold.
customer_reviews.author: mireader

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy replacement for 2010 Forte 2.0L. Comes with gasket which is easier than using sealant for me. No leaks found a year later. Filter looked exactly like original.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: 2009 ELANTRA GLS, Decent Quality, Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality, perfect fit. Pretty much identical to the OEM filter I removed. The gasket seems to be very good quality too.
customer_reviews.author: MM8

customer_reviews.title: Works great on a 2009 Elentra
customer_reviews.text: Works great on a 2009 Elentra. Took the risk of using the gasket instead of re-sealing. 5k miles and no leaks, gasket is holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Jgreen

customer_reviews.title: Beck Arnley 044-0363 Auto Trans Filter
customer_reviews.text: Looked identical to the filter it replaced on my 2011 Kia SOUL at a third of the price of a dealer part, also included the rubber pan gasket for a leak free install.
customer_reviews.author: G. Everett

customer_reviews.title: Gasket could have came with a small bit of sealant for good measure
customer_reviews.text: The filter was an exact fit the fitment oring fit firm in transmission slot the pan gasket from factory was only sealant so gasket i feel was a plus
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Fit 2008 elantra perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't have torgue specs for tranny pan bolts. Just tightened to 20 in lbs and everything is fine. No leaks.
customer_reviews.author: SS21

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for 2009 Elantra SE
customer_reviews.text: Everything was quality, lined up perfectly. I used AT form a gasket along with the gasket (manufacturer recommends form a gasket with no physical gasket).
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Job well done!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit & it included a pan gasket; no need for a tube of anything. I will order this again on next trans. fluid change.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Fit my Kia right.
customer_reviews.text: This was an exact fit for my Kia Soul, fit right in and the gasket was fine too.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good fit. Works , 1/2 the price of local auto parts stores.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Love OEM parts
customer_reviews.text: Just a solid piece of engineering. Love OEM parts. Did not include gasket as pic shows, had to use RTV.
customer_reviews.author: Wallet hunter

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: Looks good to me & even came with a pan gasket.. Perfect fit & easy to install... I would recommend to a friend...
customer_reviews.author: William D. Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Fits a 2006 Kia Spectra5
customer_reviews.text: Per all the local automotive stores the transmission must be taken apart to change the filter. Well after removing the trans pan I found that the filter was able to be replaced. Unfortunately, ALL the local stores had an incorrect transmission filter :-( Amazon to the rescue with the right transmission filter!
customer_reviews.author: lebean

customer_reviews.title: for Elantra 2008
customer_reviews.text: It fits very Good for my Elantra 2008. Like the Oringial.No Problems so far. I keep the old one and washed it out.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Came with gasket which was nice to avoid using RTV everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Arrived and fit perfectly into 2009 Hyundai Elantra. Came with gasket which was nice to avoid using RTV everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Byrd

customer_reviews.title: NOTHING, THIS IS NOTHING
customer_reviews.text: I WOULD NEVER RECOMEND THIS ITEM, THEY DONT SHOW ANY LOGO,AT ALL, SO WHO DID IT? WHO KNOWS A FILTER WITH OUT ANY LETTER, NO NAME, NOTHING, YOU'LL FEEL ALONG. IF I'M GOING TO BUY SOME THING LIKE THAT, I PREFER BUY FROM THE DEALER, JUST $ 10-12 MORE, IT WORTH.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT

product_meta.title: Beck Arnley 044-0363 Auto Trans Filter
product_meta.description: Beck/Arnley parts meet foreign nameplate OE specifications for form, fit and function. Our product specialists work with a network of global sourcing partners so you can install the right part with confidence.
feature_bullets: Matches OE form, fit, and function
Includes O-rings and/or gaskets that are required for complete filter installation
A premium manufactured rubber pan gasket is included if applicable
Application specific to ensure a correct fit for your vehicle
Be sure to use the specific ATF formulated for this transmission - check Beck/Arnley catalog

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars53 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
